name: michelle ford
text: Recently visited Blaze, traveling from the MS Gulf Coast, to eat at one of my Husband's favorite pizza places for his birthday. COVID social distancing put a damper on the once enjoyable experience of creating your own pizza and the ‚Ä¶More

name: Greg Johnson
text: Got a gluten free pizza here to go.  I like the different options.  Due to #covid-19, they were limiting the toppings and not doing drink refills.  There had cookie cutter type pizzas that you could order.  The one pictured is a meat lovers with bacon on a gluten free crust.  I do recommend

name: Kitty Smart
text: WORST pizza I have ever had! A frozen Red Baron pizza would have been a better choice. The pepperoni pizza was so burned and rubbery. We also got a garlic and pesto one. It was barely cooked. The staff was super friendly so they get the one star!

name: Ashley Holmeshy
text: First off let me say how awesome their staff was! The gentleman on the register called me by name and even was accepting of my corner brownie request. The icing though was I forgot to ask for cheese as a topping well without hesitation the ‚Ä¶More

name: Alysha
text: Blaze is by far the perfect pizza place! And the blood orange drink is delicious! Great prices and build your own pizza is an awesome option for my picky self.

name: Courtney S
text: My first experience was pretty good, but the second one was not so good and they haven‚Äôt responded to my complaint, I‚Äôve sent it multiple times on multiple sites... Our pizza arrived burnt a while back and I reached out through the website ‚Ä¶More

name: Life atfreewill
text:
I don't know where to start,
New Management is awesome, Staff is quick and efficient. My pies were, hot and fresh, a little crisp how i love it. ‚Ä¶More

name: Steven Russett
text: Ordered 7 pizzas for a 7:30 pickup at 6:30.  They made all 7 at the time the order was placed. Obviously our ticket wasn't read properly. Was also apparent, that the person executing the order was the MOD. POOR!! Please do a better job of hiring and training!!!

name: Cain Walls
text: I love the pizza at this restaurant you can a whole pizza in 5 minutes

name: Henry Charles
text: I give this location a 5/5. The staff are friendly and very orderly fashioned. I absolutely love this place, it‚Äôs quick and convenient, literally 5 mins of your time. if you haven‚Äôt eaten here yet, you better soon! üëçüèΩ

name: Evelyn Adams
text: I just had my first experience with this restaurant,  and it won't be my last! The think crust provides an excellent pallete for a flavorful and well balanced pizza.

name: Daniel Smith
text: The BBQ Chicken Pizza was fantastic but the customer service was incredible! Triniti and Bruce, at the Blaze Pizza shop on O‚ÄôKeefe Ave in New Orleans, were hands down the friendliest employees I‚Äôve come across.

name: Domini Krial
text: I really like the options and varieties, but the quality goes downhill considerably when you order for delivery. Also, the pizzas have been under cooked religiously lately. I don't mind picking up and finishing in a cast iron in the oven at ‚Ä¶More

name: tee hee
text: I been here a few times and never had any issues with it. I personally love the build your own pizza cause with all their amazing and unique toppings that cant be found any where else. The stone oven pizza give the pizza a whole new level ‚Ä¶More

name: Ummer Khan
text: What a fantastic pizza. Baked fresh infront of you. Fresh toppings and a thin based pizza. Highly recommended!

name: Angel Billizone
text: Wonderful atmosphere, great customer service and an overall amazing experience!

name: Roy Michel
text: A bit pricey, but it is in the CBD, so that's understandable. Service was very good, food was wonderful. Pizza is thin crust and cooked quickly. Also there are salads you can order. Cost for a pizza starts at $8.95, so with a drink you can expect to pay about $15.00 for lunch. I would have liked a bit more toppings, but that's just me.

name: KiMDZG
text: I give this 5 stars and I'm sure 100% they deserved because this place is great pizza place if you really want to eat pizza give them Chen's and go try it ... Y can make your own pizza put or remove whatever y want they have dry too ...for me when I think of pizza I drive to the place ...I hope this review help you...enjoy your pizza .

name: Teneha B
text: I love this place BUT I love pizza. I especially love that the pizzas are only $8, plus tax ya know... But order it over the phone or with the app or online or in-person... Just get it in. ‚Ä¶More

name: nate long
text: Someone on the line can't read tickets properly. I've received the wrong dough twice. Also, the doneness of y'all pizzas vary so much. I've had perfectly cooked pizzas from this location. But a few times my pizza was overcooked or undercooked. I order through postmates.

name: Megan Widman
text: The personal pizza's are usually good, but I've only had good service here once out of maybe 10 times or more. I also had an issue with a large pizza not being cooked all the way. That's not enough to drive me away though, I really enjoy that I can load up my pizza with a variety of veggies and pesto on top.

name: Nick Demski
text: Absolute worst experience waited for over 45 minutes  to get a cold pizza. These people have no clue what they are doing. Go to any other pizza place in New Orleans and spend your money. Worst experience ever no lie!

name: brandon meyer
text: BLAZE IS AMAZING! New Orleans native and I always come and tell my friends to always check out this place!

name: Robert Martin
text: Great service. If I go back, I will ask for less sauce and more cheese. I would have given 5 stars but they don't offer straws. I agree with minimizing plastic, but they have plastic cups with giant plastic lids.

name: Hoang Vu
text: Not as fast as you'd think, considering the name and mission of the restaurant. Pretty affordable though for the amount you get and the customizations are fun. I usually get a beer and drink it while waiting for my pizza so that's pretty neat.

name: Timothy Oefelein
text: One of the best pizza places in the metro area; really good crusts, high quality ingredients, endless customization options, and a really cozy/comfortable atmosphere. ‚Ä¶More

name: Stacy Lethco
text: Excellent pizza great atmosphere and great family vibe staff was very polite and professional

name: Parth Vyas
text:
Most wonderful pizza place you'll find in New Orleans. It's infact a pizza deli!!
Pick your base, sauce and toppings(a lot to choose from) ‚Ä¶More

name: Frank Nettles
text: Delicious pizza good price awesome workers

name: Ajay Ghuman
text: I ordered 2 pizzas with 3 toppings... they charged me full price but left off the onions and green peppers and then gave me a voucher for a free pizza which was EXPIRED!!!!! I could not use the voucher on a later date. 1 star complete dissatisfaction.

name: Jill Bueche
text: One of the best pizzas I‚Äôve ever had. Every selection of crust, sauce & toppings you can think of & the servers are beyond nice w/great personalities! Will definitely be back!! üëåüëè

name: Raquel Marcelle
text:
My husband and I went here on one our date nights and we really enjoyed the pizza, the staff and the atmosphere.
You can choose whatever toppings you'd like and everything tasted fresh.
Really cute pizza place!!!

name: Gregg Gaines
text: The staff is great. The lines can get long at lunch time. Seafood needs to be added to menu. A build your own salad bar would be nice

name: Eddy Lee
text: Good food. Staff was friendly and fast.

name: Abdullah Al-Mulla
text:
Awesome staff. Super fast. One of best pizzas I've ever tried.

We had to come back on our way because this place is just Amazing!!

text: Are there anymore stars ? I've eaten at many pizza establishments. This is the Best Pizza I've ever had I found out about you guys thanks to this You Tuber name Daym Drops Super Official Food Reviews, I'm glad I saw his review about Blaze ‚Ä¶More

name: Keosha Figueroa
text: This place is Amazing!!! Stacy did a wonderful job in assisting me and the hubby! She made us feel welcomed as first time guest and we surely will be back!!!

name: Judy Weaver
text: This place is really good. Custom pizzas made by friendly staff. Gluten free and keto crust options. The gluten free is nice and crispy.

name: Kristen Parfait
text: The best price you're going to get in the city for pizza! It's just like a Chipotle but with pizza, you walk down the line and pick your toppings before they put it in the oven. Pretty quick too!

name: Ed Olsen
text: The Subway of pizza places. Great idea and reasonably priced. Atmosphere is blah....music too loud to hear employees behind the counter at normal levels and no TVs, which could go either way.

name: Josef Katz
text: decided to start writing reviews because my trip to New Orleans has been amazing and this pizza was a great way to start. never had blaze before but I wish I had one where I live after eating here 10/10

name: Nick Gurr
text: This place smelled horrible and there was terrible customer service. No toilet paper in the bathrooms either. Do not recommend. Pizza 2/10.

name: Tim Cluyts
text: Great place to get a quick pizza. Pizza is done fast and easy, would go again for sure.

name: Tasha Hansen

name: Amy
text: Build your own pizza place. It's ok. Not the best pizza but certainly not the worst. That said it was not worth the 25 minute wait in line the day I went.

name: josh mather
text: Neat concept. Food was ok. Not something I would hurry back to. The four stars are due to the great team members that helped me.

name: itza pixel
text: Introduced my omeh to this place when we were in NOLA. She found one in Arlington, TX ‚Ä¶More

name: drtgb brown
text: Love it. Downtown CBD area. Quick pizza preparing. Swift processing. And great taste!!!! ‚Ä¶More

text: Not sure what's the big deal is here, very mediocre pizza

name: Todd Spriggins
text: Great fresh pizza fast!!!

name: Jonathan Cruz

name: Joanna Moseley

text: Ordered a pie and requested fresh basil after it was cooked... Guy making the pie said you can have it cooked on or added later..... When trying to get fresh basil afterwards the employee started arguing with me that is not possible......

name: Andrea F

text: Loved the "make it your way pizza".  They will literally put anything you want on it.  And you can even ask for more and they'll oblige.   Clean restaurant  with outdoor seating out front.  Also loved their drink station with all the  different choices

text: Build your own pizza.... there's nothing better! The dough knots were good too!

name: Steve Diez
text: High quality ingredients and a great all around pizza but a not so friendly staff. By the time I got my pizza yesterday, it had cooled off and was a bit charred on one side of it. When I expressed my disappointment, the manager didn‚Äôt seem to care and didn‚Äôt offer a discount or refund.

text: This was the best pizza I've ever had

text: This is subway,  but super delicious pizza! We enjoyed the experience, the atmosphere, and the staff. Really cool place! Really good pizza! Build your own pizza rocks!

name: shannon emich
text: Best spot for vegan, allergy friendly amazing pizza!

name: Pam Burke
text: One of my favorite places. They always have specials, give back to the community, You get the pizza the way you like it, and customer service is usually good.  Only con would be the flies outside when trying to eat your pizza but other than ‚Ä¶More

name: vincent floyd
text: Great pizza in the area

name: Michael Jackson
text: Think Moe's for pizza...  Pizza is very good.  Great sauce and fresh, high quality toppings.  Fast service.  We had the veg out and arugula fruit salad both without cheese.  Left full and well satisfied.

name: Jonathan Waller
text: Great choices of toppings cooked over an open flame brick oven. Good prices and fast friendly service

name: IM FREE PROJECT
text: Blaze pizza has got to be the best pizza and the price is reasonable.  For me, I always have pizza left over for the next day or for a late dinner!  The ingredients are very fresh and plentiful and the taste is amazing! I suggest the build your own pizza...all the toppings you want on a delicious thin crust.

name: Lamon Wade

name: Shae
text: I love brick oven pizza and this place did not disappoint. We had the meat eater and it was amazing! The only thing better than the pizza is the price. If you're ever in New Orleans and looking for quality pizza, check out this place. Next time we're in New Orleans, we'll definitely be here again.

name: Ron Knipple Jr
text: What can I say. Personal pizzas made to order and cooked in front of you. Choose your crust and toppings and they bake it right there for you. Fast and efficient service.

name: Josh Green
text: Thoroughly enjoyed it. Fast-casual dining done right. The pizza was great.

name: Crimson Cuppernell
text: The staff was so friendly and helpful. Absolutely amazing pizza. Great job! Vegan friendly üëçüëç

name: Matt Santana
text: Pizza tastes good and arrived quickly. One of the pizzas was missing a topping or would be 5 stars. I would eat here again.

name: Paula Willford
text: It's nice to get a pizza that you can pick with you want. Its nice to try new things like gator. It was different but good. Go try it.

name: Darry Jackson
text: Ordered pizza on app. to start earning awards. Later discovered after dinning in that I had to scan the receipt to get awards. ????

name: Greg R
text: 2 different places day/night. Lunch time is like clockwork. Saturday evening is definitely the B staff (or F?).  This group had no idea what each were doing - all be by being yelled at by some lady with blue hair. Their timing was so bad I ‚Ä¶More

name: Mariel Oberg
text: My family just shared a pizza and ate every morsel. The service was quick and friendly and a great experience overall. Would definitely recommend!

name: Nichole Buckner

text: Awww hey, what could I say more about Blaze pizza other then, EVERYONE must go at least once. Because if you go once, you will be hooked! Its a must visit, with the food to back it up. On top of it all I have brought EVERYONE in my world to this place and you should too! Enjoy their Pizza and Blaze on!

text: A bit loud, but very good pizza. Fresh ingredients, good taste, not so big choice on what's there, but it's all good quality. I mean, what good is a thousand topping pizza place when the stuff is months old? Not so here, it's all fresh

name: Tab G
text: Did not like how I was yelled at for asking a simple question..... haven't been back since :(

name: Peter P
text: Good pizza for the price and speed. Usually pretty quick unless there's a huge rush, typically around lunch.

name: Clorestine Haney
text: The people that work there are so amazing and patient. They really know how to make your pizza,  don't forget the pineapple, lol. The guy that bake the pizza I call him the burner, lol and don't forget to drizzle it with olive oil ..... I know,  that's what they tell me üòÄüòÄüòÄ‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§

text: Great restaurant. Awesome food, affordable.

name: Jahi Jackson
text: Love this place! All the different customable options to make your pie exactly how you want it is the coolest thing!

name: Billy Hale

name: Olivia Brown
text: The service was slow but it wasn‚Äôt a problem. The anyway you want it pizza was amazing. The next time I am in town Blaze Pizza will be one of my stops.

text: Quality pizza at a reasonable price, and unless they are extremely busy, service is super fast. Nice folks there.

name: Adam Relayson
text: It's downtown, so of course parking sucks. But its still Blaze Pizza.   The food is always good.

name: Taylor Wall
text: Many different options for crust, toppings, and sauces. A little something for everyone

name: Floellen Rickard
text:
Went after a Saints game and the place was packed.  The staff was courteous and attentive, handled the crowd without any issues and the food was amazing.
Will definitely go back again.

name: Josh The Tall Dude
text: The subway of pizza. I recommend the build your own. You can put whatever you want, however much you want, on the pizza. The company modo is they can't say no.

name: Cheryl Daves
text: I was truly disappointed. Waited online for 40 min with my child just to be told they no longer carry the keto crust pizza. They should take their sign down!!!

name: David

name: Henry
text: Fantastic pizza and dough knots. Really laid back atmosphere with a cool industrial theme. 10/10 would eat here again. They need a sign for where to go once you enter though.

text: Build your own pizza any topping under 9 bucks,  yep.

name: Christopher Ard
text: They need more employees. It's supposed to be a fast process, but they move slower than normal New Orleans speed. But at least they were all nice.

name: M Stallworth
text: Blaze Pizza is a little reminder of Los Angeles for me. I was surprised to stumble upon this location, which is in the vicinity of the Superdome and the Smoothie Center. The big difference between LA and this location, they have an alligator meat option. I thinking a local delicacyüòÉ.

name: A. Butler
text: My family and I love blaze pizza. The concept is amazing and the ingredients are fresh. I get to build my pizza how I want at a great price. The staff is always friendly.

name: Sam Hess

name: NC Okeke
text: I love Blaze pizza. It's affordable and full service. I'm probably going again today

text: Horrible service... Good üçï but got overcharged and no one even try to fix it

text: having lived in Chicago most of my adult life....I can say for certain what a good pizza is...while I was not expecting Chicago quality pizza this was not bad it can definitely pass for pizza unlike other places I have been too. This place ‚Ä¶More

text: I went for the simple pie, which is just a cheese pizza. I told the pizza cook that I am a veggie and he happily told me they have a dedicated pizza cutter for vegetarians. The product is very fresh and it really does cool in mere moments. ‚Ä¶More

text: The fresh mouth-watering pizza is made to order in front of you, so you can watch it during the entire process. There are many sauce, cheese, and topping options available. It will be crowded during the lunch hour, but the line moves quickly. Highly recommended.

text: Best build your own pizza and best lunch price!!

text: The best ever. l get to choose what i want. Visual selection of topings makes it easier to choose and makes me own my choice and connected to the pizza. It is fast service. I love it.

text: Large selection of fresh toppings; one of our favorite work lunch spots.  Wait can be a bit longer than a normal fast causal places because of how busy it gets, but it's still worth trying.

name: Shawn Ousley

name: Megan Allyn

name: Theresa Margiotta

name: Morgan Thibodeaux

name: Michael Adams
text: High quality pizza, thin crust, lots of fresh ingredients to "build your own" or choose from their menu options.  Great staff eager to please and courteous. Pizza's under $8, assembled in front of you, cooked in under 2 mins. ‚Ä¶More

text: The veggies were fresh and the crust was crispy.

text: Build your own pizza is priced well! Food is good and the environment is chill.

name: Matt Davis
text: Great pizza.   Tons of choices, high quality ingredients, friendly staff.   The pizza is made to your order, fresh, and fast.  This is bigger than "personal" size pizza, I couldn't finish mine. Great portion size for only 8$.

name: Camille Breland
text: Blaze is the bomb! The pizza is seriously delicious. You can put as many toppings as you want on it, and it only takes 180 seconds to good. The staff is very friendly, and it's in a great location for anyone headed to the Super Dome or Smoothie King Center. Love it.

name: DARTH inVADER

name: Jared Lyons
text: Blaze pizza is pretty good. Fast service and you can customize the pizza exactly how you want. It takes about 90 - 120 seconds to cook the pizza.  Good refreshing lemonades, but I wouldn't recommend the salad.

name: Miguel Diaz
text: Good vegan options.
